choices.answer: A substance that is released into the environment by human activity.
Flammable gas, consisting largely of methane
Substance that flows freely but is of constant volume, having a consistent.
Firm and stable in shape; not liquid or fluid.

questions.question: What is a point source pollutant?

choices.answer: Can be broken down by decomposer organisms or physical processes e.g. light or heat.
The release of pollutants from numerous wide-spread sources
When a large amount of pollutants are released, causing a lot of harm.
The release of pollutants from a single, clearly, identifiable site

questions.question: Which of the following choices are types of pollutants?

choices.answer: Gases, Particulate Matter and Liquid chemicals
Gases, Liquid chemicals, and Solids.
Gases, Particulate Matter, Liquid chemicals, and Solid domestic waste.
Gases, Particulate Matter, Liquids, and Solid domestic waste.

questions.question: What is the difference between primary source pollutants and secondary. (P = Primary, S = Secondary)

choices.answer: S: Air pollutant released directly from a source. P: Not directly released.
P: Air pollutant released directly from a source. S: Not directly released.

questions.question: POPs are organic compounds found in the environment that break down through chemical, biological, and light process

choices.answer: True
False
Harmful to the environement.
I dont know
Can be broken down by decomposer organisms or physical processes e.g. light
Can not be broken down by decomposer organisms

questions.question: Acute pollutants: When a large amount of pollutants are released, causing a lot of harm.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Chronic pollutants: It results from short-term release but in large amounts.

choices.answer: True
False
